DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator whether the participant had aerodigestive cancer surgery.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities of the anatomic structures forming the upper respiratory tract and upper part of the digestive tract.  They include the oral cavity, sinonasal tract, pharynx, pyriform sinus, larynx, trachea, and esophagus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Anatomic structures forming the upper respiratory tract and upper part of the digestive tract.  They include the oral cavity, sinonasal tract, pharynx, pyriform sinus, larynx, trachea, and esophagus.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Anatomic structures forming the upper respiratory tract and upper part of the digestive tract. They include the oral cavity, sinonasal tract, pharynx, pyriform sinus, larynx, trachea, and esophagus.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: A specialty in which manual or operative procedures are used in the treatment of disease, injuries, or deformities.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science that treats disease or injury by operative procedures.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A choice of Yes and No answer.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

PermissibleValues.origin: OMB/NCI:Office of Management and Budget/National Cancer Institute

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: A Conceptual Domain to capture value meanings specfic to SPOREs not suitable for placement elsewhere.
ConceptualDomain.changeDescription: Changed name to match Context per Hvroje Med.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation. Indicators determine or aid in determining whether or not certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.
